page.title: 12INDUSTRY
page.content: { LEVITT HAGG QUARRY There have been several quarries in { {Warmsworth}since pre-Georgian times. Initially the limestone was used for house building, then as a fertiliser in the form of quicklime. The quarry is situated on an area of{magnesian {limestone}called{dolomite. Dolomite} contains a low percentage of iron and is used in{glass making}as a catalyst in the melting of silica. If the iron content is too high the glass becomes brown in colour.{Dolomite}produces clear glass and is therefore in high demand. The limestone is quarried using explosives, and is then crushed, and reduced to powder. It is then sold to Pilkington's{glass makers}who then transport the powder to their factories on Merseyside.
